botanical_details.genus: Helenium may be upright, clump-forming annuals, biennials or herbaceous perennials with simple leaves and showy daisy-like flower-heads over a long period

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in full sun in fertile, moisture-retentive, humus-rich soil. Keep well watered in summer dry spells. Tall stems may need support (see staking perennials). Divide every two to three years to maintain vigour
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by basal softwood cuttings in spring, or by division in spring or late autumn
how_to_grow.pruning: No pruning required, but chopping or pinching out a section of plants in late spring can result in bushier growth that flowers slightly later. This can help to hide leggy stems, though this cultivar is less prone to lower leaf drop than some others. Deadheading will also prolong flowering
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to stem and bulb eelworm, tortrix moth, slugs and snails
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to powdery mildews, leaf spot, verticillium wilt and virus diseases
